item.title: [PI] Fishing
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

ENUMS ALL THE WAY
but why is this?

[quote=“Vain_, post:11, topic:524580”][quote author=Strucker link=topic=643129.msg4330046#msg4330046 date=1373511437]
it’s just that i dont know how to use them yet
[/quote]http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/Enum.html
read that and heres an example i just wrote

[code=Java]public class SimpleEnum {
public static enum EnumName {
//USAGE(variables per enum here)
SAMPLE_ONE(1, 10, 50, 100, “Sample”),
SAMPLE_TWO(2, 20, 100, 200, “Sample two”);

    /* define variable names for each variable used in the enum */
    private int firstNumber, secondNumber, thirdNumber, fourthNumber;
    private String firstString;


    /* create a constructor for the enum */
    private EnumName(int firstNumber, int secondNumber, int thirdNumber, int fourthNumber, String firstString) {
        this.firstNumber = firstNumber;
        this.secondNumber = secondNumber;
        this.thirdNumber = thirdNumber;
        this.fourthNumber = fourthNumber;
        this.firstString = firstString;
    }

    /* create getters for each variable */
    public int getFirstNumber() {
        return firstNumber;
    }
    public int getSecondNumber() {
        return secondNumber;
    }
    public int getThirdNumber() {
        return thirdNumber;
    }
    public int getFourthNumber() {
        return fourthNumber;
    }
    public int getFirstString() {
        return firstString;
    }
}

}[/code]then usage:

... { /* loop through all the enum values */ for (final EnumName e : EnumName.values()) { /* write your conditions using getters */ if (e.getFirstNumber() < e.getFourthNumber()) { if (e.getThirdNumber() > e.getSecondNumber()) { System.out.println(e.getFirstString()); } } } }[/quote]

item.title: [PI] Fishing
item.dc:creator: @chazion chazion
item.description:
@chazion wrote:

I’m not sure if any1 will use this or if this is even good but this seems to work as a base for fishing. Made it myself and still working on it. I know theres better ways

[code=java]package server.model.players.skills.impl;

import java.util.ArrayList;

import server.event.CycleEvent;
import server.event.CycleEventContainer;
import server.event.CycleEventHandler;
import server.model.players.Client;
import server.util.Misc;

public class Fishing {

private int[] NPCID = { 233, 234 };
ArrayList<Integer> npcid = new ArrayList<Integer>();

private int[] LEVELREQ = { 1, 10 };
ArrayList<Integer> levelreq = new ArrayList<Integer>();

private int[] FISHGIVEN = { 317, 333 };
ArrayList<Integer> fishgiven = new ArrayList<Integer>();

private int[] EXPGIVEN = { 10, 50 };
ArrayList<Integer> expgiven = new ArrayList<Integer>();

public void init(Client c, int id, int lvl) {
	loadData();

	if (lvl >= levelreq.get(npcid.indexOf(id))) {
		start(c, id);
	} else {
		c.sendMessage("You need a fishing level of at least "
				+ levelreq.get(npcid.indexOf(id)));
	}

}

private void start(final Client c, final int id) {

	CycleEventHandler.getSingleton().addEvent(this, new CycleEvent() {

		public void execute(CycleEventContainer container) {

			if (c.getItems().freeSlots() <= 0 || c.isMoving || !c.isActive) {
				c.sendMessage("STOP STOP SOP");
				container.stop();
			}

			if (c.fishingTimer > 0) {
				c.fishingTimer--;
				c.sendMessage("" + c.fishingTimer);
			}
			if (c.fishingTimer <= 0) {
				c.getItems().addItem(fishgiven.get(npcid.indexOf(id)), 1);
				c.fishingTimer = Misc.random(10);
			}
		}

		@Override
		public void stop() {
			c.startAnimation(-1);
		}
	}, 1);
}

private void loadData() {
	if (npcid.size() != NPCID.length) {
		for (int i = 0; i < NPCID.length; i++) {
			npcid.add(NPCID[i]);
			levelreq.add(LEVELREQ[i]);
			fishgiven.add(FISHGIVEN[i]);
			expgiven.add(EXPGIVEN[i]);
		}
	}

}

}
[/code]
